result.execSummary:
The defendant Jody Terrell Byrd Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).
  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: EACH COUNT:  Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable court costs and surcharges to be deducted from 25% of prison wages or by 11/12/15.  If not paid, a civil judgment is entered.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with current sentence.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jody Terrell Byrd Sr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jody Terrell Byrd in court with attorney Mark Lipscomb.  Defendant Jody Terrell Byrd in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is scheduled for final pretrial today, case is no longer in trial posture. Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNTS 1 & 2. On motion of the State, Court orders COUNT 3 dismissed and read-in. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Statements made as to sentencing.  
As to COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS CONCURRENT TO CURRENT SENTENCE; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  
As to COUNT 2: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs to be deducted from 25% of prison wages or by 11.12.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is entered.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges to be deducted from 25% of prison wages or by 11.12.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is entered.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 

Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Order to Produce for Plea/Sentencing  Hearing on August 13, 2015 @ 1:30pm received and filed

Attorney Mark Lipscomb in court, defendant Jody Terrell Byrd not in court, in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for final pretrial on 8.24.15 and for jury trial on 9.9.15.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 08-24-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jody Terrell Byrd in court with attorney Mark Lipscomb.  Defendant Jody Terrell Byrd in custody.  Ronald Dague for Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #07CF4492 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:Chad Boyack-MPD Officer.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jody Terrell Byrd in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Jody Terrell Byrd in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. Defendant entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
